general_texts:
The Actuarial Science major is selective based on GPA and the strength of academic preparation for the major. Students are required to:

1) Complete community college courses equivalent to the following 12-13 lower division UCR Business Administration major requirements listed below.

2) Attain a minimum GPA of 2.70 in all UC transferable course work, and a minimum 2.50 GPA in the 12-13 lower division major prerequisites listed below.

(This GPA is a baseline for consideration and not a guarantee of admission.)

3) Complete IGETC/CAL-GETC or the UCR breadth pattern for the School of Business.


AP Exam - Satisfy Course Requirement Section

Economics: Macroeconomics Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies ECON 2

Economics: Microeconomics Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies ECON 3

Mathematics: AB Exam or AB Subscore from BC Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies MATH 9A or MATH 7A

Mathematics: BC Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies MATH 9A and MATH 9B or MATH 7A and MATH 7B

Minimum score of 4 satisfies MATH 9A, MATH 9B, MATH 9C or MATH 7A, MATH 7B, MATH 9C

Statistics Exam

Minimum score of 4 satisfies STAT 8 or STAT 10


If sending institution offers honors/enhanced/support courses, the articulation for the same course number will be used.


For more information regarding this major and UCR's transfer selection process, please visit Actuarial Science.

For information about the UC Transfer Admission Guarantee (TAG) program, please visit Transfer Admission Guarantee.

general_texts:
Admission to majors housed in the College of Humanities, Arts and Social Sciences is selective based on GPA in all transferrable coursework, with a minimum GPA of 2.40 (this is a baseline GPA for consideration and not a guarantee of admission). Applicants with 80 semester/120 quarter units or more (e.g. a combination of 4-year and community college course work) are subject to additional screening. Although completion of the course work listed below is not mandatory prior to admission, students are advised to complete as much lower division course preparation as possible prior to transfer. Completion of lower division course work prepares students for upper division work at UCR and helps students move more efficiently towards graduation.


If sending institution offers honors/enhanced/support courses, the articulation for the same course number will be used.


IGETC/CAL-GETC and General Education/Breadth Information

In addition to the lower division requirements listed below, students are also encouraged to complete the IGETC or CAL-GETC while attending community college. Students completing CAL-GETC may have an additional "Language other than English" requirement, which can be met with coursework completed at UCR or with applicable transfer credit. Although completion of the IGETC/CAL-GETC is not a UCR admission requirement, it is a good program for students planning to transfer into majors housed in the College of Humanities, Arts and Social Sciences. Information about completing IGETC/CAL-GETC is available at each community college. Students also have the option of completing the UCR CHASS breadth pattern, you may view the breath requirements for by visiting the 2025-26 Catalog, pages 86-87.

For additional information about the African American Studies major, please visit African American Studies.

For information about the UC Transfer Admissions Guarantee (TAG) program, please visit Transfer Admission Guarantee.

general_texts:
Applicants to majors in the College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences are selected on the basis of their academic preparation, as assessed by their GPA and the strength of preparation for their intended major. A GPA of at least 2.70 is required (this is a baseline GPA for consideration and not a guarantee of admission). Courses must be completed with a letter grade, with no grade lower than a "C". To be best prepared for upper division course work at UCR, students are advised to complete as many as possible of the lower division major requirements listed below prior to transfer, and to prioritize this course work above completion of breadth/general education courses.


Effective Fall 2024 transfer students must complete all Chemistry lab courses in-person to receive articulation to UCRs equivalent Chemistry lab courses. Completing Chemistry lab courses online will not impact your ability to transfer. Transfer students who complete Chemistry lab courses online will be required to retake the lab courses at UCR.


If sending institution offers honors/enhanced/support courses, the articulation for the same course number will be used.


IGETC/CAL-GETC and General Education/Breadth Information

The College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences (CNAS) accepts completion of the IGETC or CAL-GETC as satisfying the colleges lower-division general education/breadth requirements for transfer students.

Students completing CAL-GETC and pursuing a Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) degree may have an additional "Language Other Than English" requirement, which can be met with coursework completed at UCR or with applicable transfer credit. Transfer students who wish to supplement their math and science preparation with humanities or social science courses are encouraged to follow the College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences breadth pattern. You may view the breadth requirements for College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences by visiting the 2025-26 Catalog, pages 94-96.

In addition, complete community college courses comparable to the following UCR sequences in order to meet selection criteria for this major. Courses must be completed with "C" grades or better prior to transfer.


Mandatory Series

Biology BIOL 5A/5LA

Chemistry CHEM 1A/LA, CHEM 1B/LB, CHEM 1C/LC

Math Math 9A, MATH 9B or MATH 7A, MATH 7B

Organic Chemistry CHEM 8A/8LA, CHEM 8B/LB, CHEM 8C/LC


AP Exam - Satisfy Course Requirement Section

Mathematics: A Exam or AB Subscore from BC Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies MATH 9A or MATH 7A

Mathematics: BC Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies MATH 9A and MATH 9B or MATH 7A and MATH 7B

Minimum score of 4 satisfies MATH 9A, MATH 9B, MATH 9C or MATH 7A, MATH 7B, MATH 9C

Physics: C Exam - Mechanics

Minimum score of 4 satisfies PHYS 2A and 2LA


For additional information about the Biochemistry major, please visit Biochemistry.

For information about the UC Transfer Admission Guarantee (TAG) program, please visit Transfer Admission Guarantee.

general_texts:
All majors in the Bourns College of Engineering are selective, based on academic preparation and GPA in all transferable coursework, with a minimum GPA of 2.80 This is a baseline GPA for consideration and not a guarantee of admission.


Effective Fall 2024 transfer students must complete all Chemistry lab courses in-person to receive articulation to UCRs equivalent Chemistry lab courses. Completing Chemistry lab courses online will not impact your ability to transfer. Transfer students who complete Chemistry lab courses online will be required to retake the lab courses at UCR.


Prior to transfer, a minimum GPA of at least 2.50 in the calculus series and at least one additional series.


If sending institution offers honors/enhanced/support courses, the articulation for the same course number will be used.


For more information regarding this major and UCR's transfer selection process, please visit Bourns College of Engineering General Requirements.

For information about the UC Transfer Admission Guarantee (TAG) program, please visit Transfer Admission Guarantee.


IGETC/CAL-GETC and General Education/Breadth Information

The Bourns College of Engineering (BCOE) accepts completion of IGETC or CAL-GETC as satisfying the college's lower division general education/breadth requirements for transfer students. Additional upper division breadth requirements may be required after enrollment in BCOE. Please visit "GE Areas - Transfer Institution" for the complete list of required GE/Breadth Articulation Agreement. For more information on BCOE breadth requirements, go to Bourns College of Engineering Breadth Requirements. Prospective applicants are strongly encouraged to focus instead on preparatory course work for the major, such as the mathematics, science and other technical preparatory course work listed below, rather than IGETC. Strong technical preparation is essential for success in the admissions process, and subsequently, in all coursework at BCOE.

AP Exam - Satisfy Course Requirement Section

Mathematics: AB Exam or AB Subscore from BC Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies MATH 9A or MATH 7A

Mathematics: BC Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies MATH 9A and MATH 9B or MATH 7A and MATH 7B

Minimum score of 4 satisfies MATH 9A, MATH 9B, MATH 9C or MATH 7A, MATH 7B, MATH 9C

general_texts:
The Business Administration major is selective based on GPA and the strength of academic preparation for the major. Students are required to:

1) Complete community college courses equivalent to the following six lower division UCR Business Administration major requirements listed below.

2) Attain a minimum GPA of 2.70 in all UC transferable course work, and a minimum 2.50 GPA in the six lower division major prerequisites listed below. (This GPA is a baseline for consideration and not a guarantee of admission.)

3) Complete IGETC/CAL-GETC or the UCR breadth pattern for the College of Humanities, Arts and Social Sciences.


Note: Students who complete a course in Managerial Accounting (usually the second semester of accounting at the community college) prior to transfer will receive subject credit for UCR's upper division course BUS 108 "Financial Evaluation and Managerial Analysis", which is a required course for the Business Administration major. Although students who choose to complete a lower division managerial accounting course prior to transfer will not be required to take BUS 108 after transfer, they will still need to attain a minimum number of upper division units at UCR for the Business Administration degree.


AP Exam - Satisfy Course Requirement Section

Economics: Macroeconomics Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies ECON 2

Economics: Microeconomics Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies ECON 3


Mathematics: AB Exam or AB Subscore from BC Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies MATH 9A or MATH 7A

Mathematics: BC Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies MATH 9A and MATH 9B or MATH 7A and MATH 7B

Minimum score of 4 satisfies MATH 9A, MATH 9B, MATH 9C or MATH 7A, MATH 7B, MATH 9C

Statistics Exam

Minimum score of 4 satisfies STAT 8


If sending institution offers honors/enhanced/support courses, the articulation for the same course number will be used.


For further information about the Business Administration major, please visit Business Administration.

For information about the UC Transfer Admission Guarantee program, please visit the Transfer Admission Guarantee.


Note: A course articulated to UCR's Math 9A (for schools on the semester system), or a series articulated to UCR's Math 9A-9B (for schools on the quarter system) will be accepted in lieu of Math 22 at UCR.

Although completion of the course work listed below is not mandatory prior to admission, students are advised to complete as much lower division course preparation as possible prior to transfer. Admission to majors housed in the College of Humanities, Arts and Social Sciences is selective based on GPA in all transferrable coursework, with a minimum GPA of 2.40 (this is a baseline GPA for consideration and not a guarantee of admission). Applicants with 80 semester/120 quarter units or more (e.g. a combination of 4-year and community college course work) are subject to additional screening.


Although completion of the course work listed below is not mandatory prior to admission, students are advised to complete as much lower division course preparation as possible prior to transfer. Completion of lower division course work prepares students for upper division work at UCR and helps students move more efficiently towards graduation.


If sending institution offers honors/enhanced/support courses, the articulation for the same course number will be used.


For additional information about this major, please visit Economics.

For information about the UC Transfer Admissions Guarantee program, please visit Transfer Admissions Guarantee.

If sending institution offers honors/enhanced/support courses, the articulation for the same course number will be used.


For more information regarding this major and UCR's transfer selection process, please visit Bourns College of Engineering General Requirements.

For information about the UC Transfer Admission Guarantee (TAG) program, please visit Transfer Admission Guarantee.


IGETC/CAL-GETC and General Education/Breadth Information

The Bourns College of Engineering (BCOE) accepts completion of IGETC or CAL-GETC as satisfying the college's lower division general education/breadth requirements for transfer students. Additional upper division breadth requirements may be required after enrollment in BCOE. Please visit "GE Areas - Transfer Institution" for the complete list of required GE/Breadth Articulation Agreement. For more information on BCOE breadth requirements, go to Bourns College of Engineering Breadth Requirements. Prospective applicants are strongly encouraged to focus instead on preparatory course work for the major, such as the mathematics, science and other technical preparatory course work listed below, rather than IGETC. general_texts:
Applicants to majors in the College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences are selected on the basis of their academic preparation, as assessed by their GPA and the strength of preparation for their intended major. A GPA of at least 2.70 is required (this is a baseline GPA for consideration and not a guarantee of admission). Courses must be completed with a letter grade, with no grade lower than a "C". To be best prepared for upper division course work at UCR, students are advised to complete as many as possible of the lower division major requirements listed below prior to transfer, and to prioritize this course work above completion of breadth/general education courses.


Effective Fall 2024 transfer students must complete all Chemistry lab courses in-person to receive articulation to UCRs equivalent Chemistry lab courses. Completing Chemistry lab courses online will not impact your ability to transfer. Transfer students who complete Chemistry lab courses online will be required to retake the lab courses at UCR.


If sending institution offers honors/enhanced/support courses, the articulation for the same course number will be used.


IGETC/CAL-GETC and General Education/Breadth Information

The College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences (CNAS) accepts completion of the IGETC or CAL-GETC as satisfying the colleges lower-division general education/breadth requirements for transfer students.

Students completing CAL-GETC and pursuing a Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) degree may have an additional "Language Other Than English" requirement, which can be met with coursework completed at UCR or with applicable transfer credit. Transfer students who wish to supplement their math and science preparation with humanities or social science courses are encouraged to follow the College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences breadth pattern. You may view the breadth requirements for College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences by visiting the 2025-26 Catalog, pages 94-96.

In addition, complete community college courses comparable to at least two of the following UCR year-long series in order to meet selection criteria for this major. Courses must be completed with "C" grades or better prior to transfer. First year calculus required, the second sequence can be chosen from options listed under Potential Course Series.


Potential Course Series

Math Math 9A, MATH 9B or MATH 7A, MATH 7B (mandatory)

Biology BIOL 5A/5LA, BIOL 5B (and BIOL 5C, if articulated)

Chemistry CHEM 1A/LA, CHEM 1B/LB, CHEM 1C/LC

Math Math 9C, MATH 10A, Math 10B, Math 46

Physics PHYS 2A/LA, PHYS 2B/LB, PHYS 2C/2LC or PHYS 40A, PHYS 40B, PHYS 40C

Organic Chemistry CHEM 8A/LA, CHEM 8B/LB, CHEM 8C/LC (minimum grade of "B" required)


AP Exam - Satisfy Course Requirement Section

Mathematics: AB Exam or AB Subscore from BC Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies MATH 9A or MATH 7A

Mathematics: BC Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies MATH 9A and MATH 9B or MATH 7A and MATH 7B

Minimum score of 4 satisfies MATH 9A, MATH 9B, MATH 9C or MATH 7A, MATH 7B, MATH 9C

Physics: C Exam - Mechanics

Minimum score of 4 satisfies PHYS 2A and 2LA


For additional information about this major, please visit Entomology.

For information about the UC Transfer Admission Guarantee (TAG) program, please visit Transfer Admission Guarantee.

If sending institution offers honors/enhanced/support courses, the articulation for the same course number will be used.


IGETC/CAL-GETC and General Education/Breadth Information

The College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences (CNAS) accepts completion of the IGETC or CAL-GETC as satisfying the colleges lower-division general education/breadth requirements for transfer students.

Students completing CAL-GETC and pursuing a Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) degree may have an additional "Language Other Than English" requirement, which can be met with coursework completed at UCR or with applicable transfer credit. Transfer students who wish to supplement their math and science preparation with humanities or social science courses are encouraged to follow the College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences breadth pattern. You may view the breadth requirements for College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences by visiting the 2025-26 Catalog, pages 94-96.

In addition, complete community college courses comparable to at least two of the following UCR year-long series in order to meet selection criteria for this major. Courses must be completed with "C" grades or better prior to transfer. First year calculus is required, the second series can be chosen from options listed under Potential Course Series.


Potential Course Series

Math Math 9A, MATH 9B, MATH 9C (mandatory) (or Math 7A, MATH 7B, MATH 46, if articulated)

Biology BIOL 5A/5LA, BIOL 5B (and BIOL 5C, if articulated)

Chemistry CHEM 1A/LA, CHEM 1B/LB

Math MATH 10A, MATH 10B, MATH 46

Physics PHYS 40A, PHYS 40B or PHYS 2A/LA, PHYS 2B/LB


AP Exam - Satisfy Course Requirement Section

Computer Science: A Exam

Minimum score of 4 satisfies CS 10A

Mathematics: AB Exam or AB Subscore from BC Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies MATH 9A or MATH 7A

Mathematics: BC Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies MATH 9A and MATH 9B or MATH 7A and MATH 7B

Minimum score of 4 satisfies MATH 9A, MATH 9B, MATH 9C or MATH 7A, MATH 7B, MATH 9C

Physics: C Exam - Mechanics

Score of 4 satisfies PHYS 2A and PHYS 2LA


For additional information about this major, please visit Geophysics.

For information about the UC Transfer Admission Guarantee (TAG) program, please visit Transfer Admission Guarantee.

Admission to majors housed in the College of Humanities, Arts and Social Sciences is selective based on GPA in all transferrable coursework, with a minimum GPA of 2.40 (this is a baseline GPA for consideration and not a guarantee of admission). Information about completing IGETC/CAL-GETC is available at each community college. Students also have the option of completing the UCR CHASS breadth pattern, you may view the breath requirements for by visiting the 2025-26 Catalog, pages 86-87.
For information about the UC Transfer Admission Guarantee (TAG) program, please visit Transfer Admission Guarantee.

Transfer students who wish to pursue this major must first be admitted into UCR first, as students proposing a major must have a faculty advisor who is a member of the UCR Academic Senate. The Humanities and Social Sciences major is an interdisciplinary major designed for students who have specific interests which cannot be accommodated within any one of the departments in the College of Humanities, Arts and Social Sciences, and who wish to construct a coherent program of their own. The Humanities and Social Sciences major is not intended for students whose interests are undecided; students proposing a Humanities and Social Sciences major are required to propose a specifically focused interdisciplinary topic or a two-field area.


The Humanities and Social Sciences major is fulfilled by a course of studies determined in consultation with an advisor and with the full approval of the chair and three members of the Committee overseeing the major. The student may construct either an interdisciplinary option or a two-field option for the major as described below. Students who wish to select a Humanities and Social Sciences major are required to fill out a form and submit a carefully worded statement of purpose showing meaningful course interrelations. The Humanities and Social Sciences Interdisciplinary Committee considers each proposal in the context of the student's topic and statement of purpose.


The Interdisciplinary option is built around a central concept in humanities and social sciences. The concept might be a specific culture, country or ethnic group such as French civilization and culture; an age or period such as the Renaissance or the industrial revolution; a great social issue or human problem such as war, revolution, communication; or any other topic which receives significant attention from several disciplines.


In special circumstances the Committee sponsors a two-field option for the major designed to allow students to combine studies in two disciplines. Such majors are approved only if they cannot be accommodated within a dual major or within the Liberal Studies Program.

Admission to majors housed in the College of Humanities, Arts and Social Sciences is selective based on GPA in all transferrable coursework, with a minimum GPA of 2.40 (this is a baseline GPA for consideration and not a guarantee of admission). Although completion of the course work listed below is not mandatory prior to admission, students are advised to complete as much lower division course preparation as possible prior to transfer. If sending institution offers honors/enhanced/support courses, the articulation for the same course number will be used.

Students completing CAL-GETC may have an additional "Language other than English" requirement, which can be met with coursework completed at UCR or with applicable transfer credit. Although completion of the IGETC/CAL-GETC is not a UCR admission requirement, it is a good program for students planning to transfer into majors housed in the College of Humanities, Arts and Social Sciences. Information about completing IGETC/CAL-GETC is available at each community college. Students also have the option of completing the UCR CHASS breadth pattern, you may view the breath requirements for by visiting the 2025-26 Catalog, pages 86-87.

general_texts:
Applicants to majors in the College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences are selected on the basis of their academic preparation, as assessed by their GPA and the strength of preparation for their intended major. A GPA of at least 2.70 is required (this is a baseline GPA for consideration and not a guarantee of admission). Courses must be completed with a letter grade, with no grade lower than a "C". To be best prepared for upper division course work at UCR, students are advised to complete as many as possible of the lower division major requirements listed below prior to transfer, and to prioritize this course work above completion of breadth/general education courses.


Effective Fall 2024 transfer students must complete all Chemistry lab courses in-person to receive articulation to UCRs equivalent Chemistry lab courses. Completing Chemistry lab courses online will not impact your ability to transfer. Transfer students who complete Chemistry lab courses online will be required to retake the lab courses at UCR.


If sending institution offers honors/enhanced/support courses, the articulation for the same course number will be used.


IGETC/CAL-GETC and General Education/Breadth Information

The College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences (CNAS) accepts completion of the IGETC or CAL-GETC as satisfying the colleges lower-division general education/breadth requirements for transfer students.

Students completing CAL-GETC and pursuing a Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) degree may have an additional "Language Other Than English" requirement, which can be met with coursework completed at UCR or with applicable transfer credit. Transfer students who wish to supplement their math and science preparation with humanities or social science courses are encouraged to follow the College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences breadth pattern. You may view the breadth requirements for College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences by visiting the 2025-26 Catalog, pages 94-96.

In addition, complete community college courses comparable to at least two of the following UCR year-long series in order to meet selection criteria for this major. Courses must be completed with "C" grades or better prior to transfer. First year calculus is required, the second series can be chosen from options listed under Potential Course Series.


Potential Course Series

Math Math 9A, MATH 9B, MATH 9C (mandatory)

Biology BIOL 5A/LA, BIOL 5B (and BIOL 5C, if articulated)

Chemistry CHEM 1A/LA, CHEM 1B/LB, CHEM 1C/LC

Math Math 10A, MATH 10B, MATH 46

Physics PHYS 40A, PHYS 40B, PHYS 40C


AP Exam - Satisfy Course Requirement Section

Computer Science: A Exam

Minimum score of 4 satisfies CS 10

Mathematics: AB Exam or AB Subscore from BC Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies MATH 9A or MATH 7A

Mathematics: BC Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies MATH 9A and MATH 9B or MATH 7A and MATH 7B

Minimum score of 4 satisfies MATH 9A, MATH 9B, MATH 9C or MATH 7A, MATH 7B, MATH 9C


For additional information about this major, please visit Mathematics.

For additional information about the Middle East and Islamic Studies major, please visit their web site at Middle East and Islamic Studies.

Language Requirement: 4 courses (16 units) Students are required to fulfill the language requirement by taking 4 classes in a language in MEIS (Arabic, Persian, Turkish, Hebrew, Urdu, Malay/ Indonesian) or pass the proficiency requirement by taking a test administered by the department.

The Middle East and Islamic Studies major is designed to provide undergraduate students with a broad understanding of the history, politics and culture of the Middle East and Islamic traditions. The major offers an interdisciplinary approach to the study of the Middle East and Islamic traditions with focuses on gender, history, literature, popular discourses and politics, which canvass from North Africa to Southeast Asia. The multidisciplinary nature of the program prepares students for a critical understanding of current issues and further study in a number of academic fields at the graduate level. The major is useful to students planning careers in politics and government, business, education, international organizations, journalism, and the arts, as well as for those who simply desire a better understanding of the Middle East, Islam and Islamic cultures.

general_texts:
Applicants to majors in the College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences are selected on the basis of their academic preparation, as assessed by their GPA and the strength of preparation for their intended major. A GPA of at least 2.70 is required (this is a baseline GPA for consideration and not a guarantee of admission). Courses must be completed with a letter grade, with no grade lower than a "C". To be best prepared for upper division course work at UCR, students are advised to complete as many as possible of the lower division major requirements listed below prior to transfer, and to prioritize this course work above completion of breadth/general education courses.


Effective Fall 2024 transfer students must complete all Chemistry lab courses in-person to receive articulation to UCRs equivalent Chemistry lab courses. Completing Chemistry lab courses online will not impact your ability to transfer. Transfer students who complete Chemistry lab courses online will be required to retake the lab courses at UCR.


If sending institution offers honors/enhanced/support courses, the articulation for the same course number will be used.


IGETC/CAL-GETC and General Education/Breadth Information

The College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences (CNAS) accepts completion of the IGETC or CAL-GETC as satisfying the colleges lower-division general education/breadth requirements for transfer students.

Students completing CAL-GETC and pursuing a Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) degree may have an additional "Language Other Than English" requirement, which can be met with coursework completed at UCR or with applicable transfer credit. Transfer students who wish to supplement their math and science preparation with humanities or social science courses are encouraged to follow the College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences breadth pattern. You may view the breadth requirements for College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences by visiting the 2025-26 Catalog, pages 94-96.

In addition, complete community college courses comparable to at least two of the following UCR year-long series in order to meet selection criteria for this major. Courses must be completed with "C" grades or better prior to transfer. First year calculus is required, the second series can be chosen from options listed under Potential Course Series.


Potential Course Series

Math Math 9A, MATH 9B, or Math 7A, MATH 7B (mandatory)

Biology BIOL 5A/5LA, BIOL 5B (and BIOL 5C, if articulated)

Chemistry CHEM 1A/LA, CHEM 1B/LB, CHEM 1C/LC

Math Math 9C, MATH 10A, Math 10B, Math 46

Physics PHYS 2A/LA, PHYS 2B/LB, PHYS 2C/2LC or PHYS 40A, PHYS 40B, PHYS 40C


AP Exam - Satisfy Course Requirement Section

Mathematics: AB Exam or AB Subscore from BC Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies MATH 9A or MATH 7A

Mathematics: BC Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies MATH 9A and MATH 9B or MATH 7A and MATH 7B

Minimum score of 4 satisfies MATH 9A, MATH 9B, MATH 9C or MATH 7A, MATH 7B, MATH 9C

Physics: C Exam - Mechanics

Minimum score of 4 satisfies PHYS 2A and 2LA


For additional information about this major, please visit Neuroscience.

For information about the UC Transfer Admission Guarantee (TAG) program, please visit Transfer Admission Guarantee.

general_texts:
Admission to majors housed in the College of Humanities, Arts and Social Sciences is selective based on GPA in all transferrable coursework, with a minimum GPA of 2.40 (this is a baseline GPA for consideration and not a guarantee of admission). Applicants with 80 semester/120 quarter units or more (e.g. a combination of 4-year and community college course work) are subject to additional screening. Although completion of the course work listed below is not mandatory prior to admission, students are advised to complete as much lower division course preparation as possible prior to transfer. Completion of lower division course work prepares students for upper division work at UCR and helps students move more efficiently towards graduation.


If sending institution offers honors/enhanced/support courses, the articulation for the same course number will be used.


IGETC/CAL-GETC and General Education/Breadth Information

In addition to the lower division requirements listed below, students are also encouraged to complete the IGETC or CAL-GETC while attending community college. Students completing CAL-GETC may have an additional "Language other than English" requirement, which can be met with coursework completed at UCR or with applicable transfer credit. Although completion of the IGETC/CAL-GETC is not a UCR admission requirement, it is a good program for students planning to transfer into majors housed in the College of Humanities, Arts and Social Sciences. Information about completing IGETC/CAL-GETC is available at each community college. Students also have the option of completing the UCR CHASS breadth pattern, you may view the breath requirements for by visiting the 2025-26 Catalog, pages 86-87.

For additional information about this major, please visit Philosophy.

For information about the UC Transfer Admission Guarantee (TAG) program, please visit Transfer Admission Guarantee.

general_texts:
Admission to the Psychology major is selective based on GPA and the student's strength of academic preparation for the major. A minimum GPA of 2.70 is required (This is a baseline GPA for consideration and not a guarantee of admission). All courses must be taken for a letter grade. To earn credit towards UCR Psychology major requirements, courses must be completed a with no grade lower than a "C-". Transfer students are strongly encouraged to complete as much lower division preparation as possible prior to transfer, as they are required to complete all lower division requirements within one year of matriculation to UCR.


AP Exam - Satisfy Course Requirement Section

Mathematics: AB Exam or AB Subscore from BC Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies MATH 9A or MATH 7A

Mathematics: BC Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies MATH 9A and MATH 9B or MATH 7A and MATH 7B

Minimum score of 4 satisfies MATH 9A, MATH 9B, MATH 9C or MATH 7A, MATH 7B, MATH 9C

Psychology Exam

Minimum score of 4 satisfies PSYC 2


If sending institution offers honors/enhanced/support courses, the articulation for the same course number will be used.


For additional information about this major, please visit Psychology.

For information about the UC Transfer Admission Guarantee (TAG) program, please visit Transfer Admission Guarantee.


IGETC/CAL-GETC and General Education/Breadth Information

In addition to the lower division requirements listed below, students are also encouraged to complete the IGETC or CAL-GETC, while attending community college. Students completing CAL-GETC ay have an additional "Language other than English" requirement, which can be met with coursework completed at UCR or with applicable transfer credit. Although completion of the IGETC is not a UCR admission requirement, it is a good program for students planning to transfer into majors housed in the College of Humanities, Arts and Social Sciences. Information about completing IGETC/CAL-GETC is available at each community college. Students also have the option of completing the UCR CHASS breadth pattern, you may view the breadth requirements by visiting the 2024-25 Catalog, pages 86-87.

Complete one Physical Sciences course, such as Chemistry, Physics, Earth Sciences, excluding Cultural Geography. Other acceptable courses include courses approved as a physical science on your community colleges IGETC pattern, and may include courses such as Oceanography, Astronomy, Geology.

Complete one Biological Sciences course, such as Biology, Botany/Plant Sciences, Entomology. Other acceptable courses include courses approved as a biological science on your community colleges IGETC pattern, and may include courses such as Marine Biology, Microbiology, Anatomy, Physiology.

Complete two additional courses from the Biological Sciences Requirement and/or Physical Science Requirement section. Additional courses that will satisfy this area are courses approved as a Mathematics course on your community colleges IGETC list (such as Statistics, Finite Math, College Algebra, Discrete Structures). The mathematics course taken to satisfy MATH 4 (or equivalent) above may not be double counted for this area. UC transferable Computer Science courses are also acceptable.

Effective Fall 2018 - Students must have completed, with a grade of C- or better, a course equivalent to UCRs MATH 4 or higher to be considered for admission to the major. Courses that articulate as MATH 5A, 6A, 9A, or 22 would meet this requirement.


Students who complete a UC transferable College Algebra course and a college course in Trigonometry (both with "C" grades or better) will be considered to have an acceptable course substitution to UCR's MATH 5A. Trigonometry courses do not carry UC transfer credit, but when taken in conjunction with College Algebra can be used to sufficiently cover content in MATH 5A.

All majors in the Bourns College of Engineering are selective, based on academic preparation and GPA in all transferable coursework, with a minimum GPA of 2.80 This is a baseline GPA for consideration and not a guarantee of admission.


Prior to transfer, a minimum GPA of at least 2.50 in the calculus sequence and at least one additional sequence.


If sending institution offers honors/enhanced/support courses, the articulation for the same course number will be used.


For more information regarding this major and UCR's transfer selection process, please visit Bourns College of Engineering General Requirements.

For information about the UC Transfer Admission Guarantee (TAG) program, please visit Transfer Admission Guarantee.


IGETC/CAL-GETC and General Education/Breadth Information

The Bourns College of Engineering (BCOE) accepts completion of IGETC or CAL-GETC as satisfying the college's lower division general education/breadth requirements for transfer students. Additional upper division breadth requirements may be required after enrollment in BCOE. Please visit "GE Areas - Transfer Institution" for the complete list of required GE/Breadth Articulation Agreement. For more information on BCOE breadth requirements, go to Bourns College of Engineering Breadth Requirements. Prospective applicants are strongly encouraged to focus instead on preparatory course work for the major, such as the mathematics, science and other technical preparatory course work listed below, rather than IGETC. Strong technical preparation is essential for success in the admissions process, and subsequently, in all coursework at BCOE.

Completion of lower division course work prepares students for upper division work at UCR and helps students move more efficiently towards graduation.


If sending institution offers honors/enhanced/support courses, the articulation for the same course number will be used.

Placement into language courses may be determined by UCR faculty evaluation of the student's appropriate language level. Students may choose from one of the following 3 Options:  Cultural Studies, Linguistics, or Literature.  All course requirements under these Options are upper division.

Applicants to majors in the College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences are selected on the basis of their academic preparation, as assessed by their GPA and the strength of preparation for their intended major. A GPA of at least 2.70 is required (this is a baseline GPA for consideration and not a guarantee of admission). Courses must be completed with a letter grade, with no grade lower than a "C". To be best prepared for upper division course work at UCR, students are advised to complete as many as possible of the lower division major requirements listed below prior to transfer, and to prioritize this course work above completion of breadth/general education courses.


Effective Fall 2024 transfer students must complete all Chemistry lab courses in-person to receive articulation to UCRs equivalent Chemistry lab courses. Completing Chemistry lab courses online will not impact your ability to transfer. Transfer students who complete Chemistry lab courses online will be required to retake the lab courses at UCR.


If sending institution offers honors/enhanced/support courses, the articulation for the same course number will be used.


IGETC/CAL-GETC and General Education/Breadth Information

The College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences (CNAS) accepts completion of the IGETC or CAL-GETC as satisfying the colleges lower-division general education/breadth requirements for transfer students.

Students completing CAL-GETC and pursuing a Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) degree may have an additional "Language Other Than English" requirement, which can be met with coursework completed at UCR or with applicable transfer credit. Transfer students who wish to supplement their math and science preparation with humanities or social science courses are encouraged to follow the College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences breadth pattern. You may view the breadth requirements for College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences by visiting the 2025-26 Catalog, pages 94-96.

In addition, applicants will need to complete community college courses comparable to at least two of the following UCR yearlong series in order to meet selection criteria for this major. Courses must be completed with "C" grades or better. To be best prepared for upper division course work at UCR, students are advised to complete as many as possible of the lower division major requirements listed below prior to transfer.


Potential Course Series

Math Math 9A, MATH 9B, MATH 9C (mandatory, minimum grade of "B "required)

Biology BIOL 5A/5LA and BIOL 5B (and BIOL 5C, if articulated)

Chemistry CHEM 1A/LA, CHEM 1B/LB, CHEM 1C/LC

Math MATH 10A, MATH 10B, MATH 31

Organic Chemistry CHEM 8A/LA, CHEM 8B/LB, CHEM 8C/LC (minimum grade of "B "required)

Physics PHYS 40A, PHYS 40B, PHYS 40C or PHYS 2A/LA, PHYS 2B/LB, PHYS 2C/LC


AP Exam - Satisfy Course Requirement Section

Mathematics: AB Exam or AB Subscore from BC Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies MATH 9A or MATH 7A

Mathematics: BC Exam

Minimum score of 3 satisfies MATH 9A and MATH 9B or MATH 7A and MATH 7B

Minimum score of 4 satisfies MATH 9A, MATH 9B, MATH 9C or MATH 7A, MATH 7B, MATH 9C

Physics: C Exam - Mechanics

Minimum score of 4 satisfies PHYS 2A and 2LA
